messages.subject: wabi-sabi..................... NOT
messages.msgSnippet: ye all, the question of wabi-sabi has been discussed recently on various message bds. May be an example of what s NOT wabi-sabi can illustrate the concept
messages.messageBody:
ye all,
the question of wabi-sabi has been discussed recently on various
message bds.
May be an example of what's NOT wabi-sabi can illustrate the concept
better ?
Please klick............
http://tinyurl.com/8tp22

there's nothing " melancholy/rustic " about this tsuba.
This one is large and heavy, completely covered with gold foil ( but
seams canot be detected )and the rim could be bound by solid gold ( a
small but more than 1mm deep cut on the mimi doesn't not show brown
color as the seppa-dai area ). This is a totally " in your face
gaudy " tsuba which , in my opinion, is not what wabi-sabi stands for.


question..........
1. are those marks on the seppa dai " secret marks " to identify the
maker/school ?
2. Professor Fox Fellman raise the point of a " daimyo tsuba ", is
there such a category as Daimyo tsuba ? Personally I think this is
more like a presentation tsuba to some " higher level " samurai ( or
on a bad day, some freakingly rich merchants' play thing ).

Thoughts, anyone ?


milt
